title: 105_hr3688
content: The text introduces a new tax credit for producing oil and gas from marginal domestic wells under the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. The tax credit for marginal well production under the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 allows for a credit amount of $3 per barrel of qualified crude oil production and 50 cents per 1,000 cubic feet of qualified natural gas production. The credit is based on the taxpayer's production of crude oil and natural gas. The tax credit for marginal well production under the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 allows for a credit amount based on the taxpayer's production of crude oil and natural gas. The applicable reference price for a taxable year is determined by the reference price for the previous calendar year. Dollar amounts in the tax credit are subject to inflation adjustments after 1999. The tax credit for marginal well production is based on the taxpayer's production of crude oil and natural gas. The reference price for a taxable year is determined by the previous calendar year, with dollar amounts subject to inflation adjustments after 1999. The reference price is defined differently for qualified crude oil and natural gas production. The tax credit for marginal well production is based on domestic crude oil or natural gas produced from a marginal well. Production exceeding 1,095 barrels or barrel equivalents in a taxable year does not qualify for the credit. The tax credit for marginal well production is based on domestic crude oil or natural gas produced from a marginal well. For a short taxable year, limitations are proportionately reduced based on the number of days in the year. Wells not in production for the entire year have limitations reduced based on the ratio of production days to total days in the year. A marginal well is defined as a domestic well that produces during the taxable year. The tax credit for marginal well production is based on domestic crude oil or natural gas produced from a marginal well. A marginal well is defined as a domestic well that produces during the taxable year, with specific terms and conversion ratios defined by section 613A. The tax credit for marginal well production is based on the taxpayer's revenue interest in qualifying crude oil or natural gas production. The credit can only be claimed on production attributable to the holder of an operating interest, excluding production from nonconventional sources. The credit is treated as a business credit under Section 38(b) of the Code. The tax credit for marginal well production is based on the taxpayer's revenue interest in qualifying crude oil or natural gas production and can only be claimed on production attributable to the holder of an operating interest. The credit is treated as a business credit under Section 38(b) of the Code and is subject to special rules outlined in subsection (c) of the Code. The tax credit for marginal well production is subject to special rules under subsection (c) of the Code, with limitations on applying the credit separately and reducing the limitation by the credit allowed for the taxable year. The tax credit for marginal oil and gas well production, defined under subsection (a) as the credit allowable by section 45D(a), includes a 10-year carryback provision. This credit is subject to special rules under the tax code, with limitations on applying it separately and reducing the limitation by the credit allowed for the taxable year. The tax credit for marginal oil and gas well production is subject to amendments in the tax code, including changes to the number of taxable years for applying certain provisions. Additionally, coordination with Section 29 is addressed, and a clerical amendment is made to the table of sections. The tax credit for producing oil and gas from marginal wells is amended by this section, with the changes applying to production after the enactment of the Act.
